channel.title: image-processing on Joseph Daws
channel.description: Recent content in image-processing on Joseph Daws

item.title: Weighted L1 Minimization and Closed Trees
Image Processing and Optimization
item.description: Weighted $\ell_1$-minimization In an upcoming work a convex optimization approach, based on weighted $\ell_1$-regularization, is proposed for reconstructing sparse wavelet representations. We show our proposed optimization problem is effective for solving the signal/image inpainting and denoising problems. We take the funcational representation of an image or signal to be $$ f(y) = \sum_{j \in \mathcal{J}} c_j \Psi_j(y) . $$ The wavelet coefficients $c = (c_j)_{j \in \mathcal{J}}$ associated to the functional representation of the object of interest are obtained as minizers of
